member.name: M:Unigine.UserInterface.#ctor(Unigine.Ptr{Gui},char,char)
member.summary: UserInterface constructor.

member.name: M:Unigine.UserInterface.getCallback(int,int) const
member.summary: Returns the number of a given callback function.
member.param: Callback type number. One of the callbacks defined in the Gui class (for example, CLICK, SHOW, HIDE, etc).

member.name: M:Unigine.UserInterface.addCallback(char,Unigine.Gui.CALLBACK_INDEX,Unigine.CallbackBase)
member.summary: Adds a callback function of the specified type for the widget with the specified name. The signature of the callback function must be as follows:
member.param: Callback type number. One of the callbacks defined in the Gui class (for example, CLICK, SHOW, HIDE, etc).
member.returns: ID of the last added callback, if the callback was added successfully; otherwise, nullptr. This ID can be used to remove this callback when necessary.

member.name: M:Unigine.UserInterface.addCallback(char,Unigine.Gui.CALLBACK_INDEX,Unigine.CallbackBase1{Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Widget}})
member.summary: Adds a callback function of the specified type for the widget with the specified name. The signature of the callback function must be as follows:
member.param: Callback type number. One of the callbacks defined in the Gui class (for example, CLICK, SHOW, HIDE, etc).
member.returns: ID of the last added callback, if the callback was added successfully; otherwise, nullptr. This ID can be used to remove this callback when necessary.

member.name: M:Unigine.UserInterface.addCallback(char,Unigine.Gui.CALLBACK_INDEX,Unigine.CallbackBase2{Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Widget},Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Widget}})
member.summary: Adds a callback function of the specified type for the widget with the specified name. The signature of the callback function must be as follows:
member.param: Callback type number. One of the callbacks defined in the Gui class (for example, CLICK, SHOW, HIDE, etc).
member.returns: ID of the last added callback, if the callback was added successfully; otherwise, nullptr. This ID can be used to remove this callback when necessary.

member.name: M:Unigine.UserInterface.addCallback(char,Unigine.Gui.CALLBACK_INDEX,Unigine.CallbackBase3{Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Widget},Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Widget},int})
member.summary: Adds a callback function of the specified type for the widget with the specified name. The signature of the callback function must be as follows:
member.param: Callback type number. One of the callbacks defined in the Gui class (for example, CLICK, SHOW, HIDE, etc).
member.returns: ID of the last added callback, if the callback was added successfully; otherwise, nullptr. This ID can be used to remove this callback when necessary.

member.name: M:Unigine.UserInterface.removeCallback(char,Unigine.Gui.CALLBACK_INDEX,void)
member.summary: Removes the specified callback from the list of callbacks of the specified type added for the widget with the given name.
member.param: Callback type number. One of the callbacks defined in the Gui class (for example, CLICK, SHOW, HIDE, etc).
Callback ID obtained when adding it.
member.returns: True if the callback with the given ID was removed successfully; otherwise false.

member.name: M:Unigine.UserInterface.clearCallbacks(char,Unigine.Gui.CALLBACK_INDEX)
member.summary: Clears all callbacks of the specified type added for the widget with the given name.
member.param: Callback type number. One of the callbacks defined in the Gui class (for example, CLICK, SHOW, HIDE, etc).

member.name: M:Unigine.UserInterface.getCallbackInstanceData(int,Unigine.Gui.CALLBACK_INDEX) const
member.summary: Returns the callback instance data.
member.param: Callback type number. One of the callbacks defined in the Gui class (for example, CLICK, SHOW, HIDE, etc).

member.name: M:Unigine.UserInterface.getCallbackName(int,Unigine.Gui.CALLBACK_INDEX) const
member.summary: Returns the name of a given callback function.
member.param: Callback type number. One of the callbacks defined in the Gui class (for example, CLICK, SHOW, HIDE, etc).

member.name: M:Unigine.UserInterface.getCallbackStringData(int,Unigine.Gui.CALLBACK_INDEX) const
member.summary: Returns the callback string data.
member.param: Callback type number. One of the callbacks defined in the Gui class (for example, CLICK, SHOW, HIDE, etc).

member.name: M:Unigine.UserInterface.getCallbackVariableData(int,Unigine.Gui.CALLBACK_INDEX) const
member.summary: Returns the callback variable data.
member.param: Callback type number. One of the callbacks defined in the Gui class (for example, CLICK, SHOW, HIDE, etc).

member.name: M:Unigine.UserInterface.getCallbackWidgetData(int,Unigine.Gui.CALLBACK_INDEX) const
member.summary: Returns the callback widget data.
member.param: Callback type number. One of the callbacks defined in the Gui class (for example, CLICK, SHOW, HIDE, etc).

member.name: M:Unigine.UserInterface.getNumCallbacks(int) const
member.summary: Returns the total number of callbacks for a given widget.

member.name: M:Unigine.UserInterface.getNumWidgets const
member.summary: Returns the number of associated widgets.

member.name: M:Unigine.UserInterface.getWidget(int) const
member.summary: Returns pointer to the widget with a given number.
member.returns: Pointer to the widget with the given number.

member.name: M:Unigine.UserInterface.getWidgetExport(int) const
member.summary: Returns a value indicating if a given widget is exported into a script.
member.returns: Returns 1 if the widget is exported; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.UserInterface.getWidgetName(int) const
member.summary: Returns widget name by its number.

member.name: M:Unigine.UserInterface.getWidgetNext(int) const
member.summary: Returns the name of the widget, which will be focused next.

member.name: M:Unigine.UserInterface.findWidget(char) const
member.summary: Searches a widget by its name.
member.returns: Returns the number of the widget if exists; otherwise, -1.

member.name: M:Unigine.UserInterface.updateWidgets const
member.summary: Updates all widgets belonging to the user interface. This function should be called, for example, after change of the interface language.

member.name: M:Unigine.UserInterface.setGui(Unigine.Ptr{Gui})
member.summary: Sets a new Gui instance to be used for the UserInterface.
member.param: Gui instance to be used for the UserInterface.

member.name: M:Unigine.UserInterface.getGui const
member.summary: Returns a Gui instance for the UserInterface.
member.returns: Gui instance currently used for the UserInterface.

member.name: M:Unigine.UserInterface.setLifetime(Widget::LIFETIME)
member.summary: Sets the lifetime management type for the UserInterface. By default, the LIFETIME_ENGINE type is used.

member.name: M:Unigine.UserInterface.getLifetime const
member.summary: Returns the lifetime management type for the root of the UserInterface, or for the UserInterface itself (if it is not a child for another UserInterface). Lifetime of each UserInterface in the hierarchy is defined by it's root. Thus, lifetime management type set for a child UserInterface that differs from the one set for the root is ignored.
